sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Canon Law Collection
msDesc.p: Vellum, 193 104 , 7.7 x 4.2, ff. 84, 28 lines to a page. Cent. xi-xii, in a hand not unlike that of Christ Church, Canterbury.
Collation: i8 ii8 iii10 iv10 (with cancels) v8-x8.
At top of f. 1 in red chalk: por. See MS 308. II, MS 323.
Rubrics in red rustic capitals. Initials green and red.

msItem.rubric: Epistola Alcuini levite ad imperatorem Karolum

lg.l: O rex augusto clarissime dignus honore
Mens pia permandet semper amare deum

msItem.ab: These lines occur at the end of the Preface to Alcuin's work de fide S. Trinitatis
msItem.rubric: Quod omnia per Christum sint. ipse uero nonfactus sed natus sit
msItem.incipit: In principio fecit deus celum et terram in christo
msItem.ab: (Alcuin de fide S. Trin. II xiv)
msItem.rubric: De unitate Trinitatis et Trinitate unitatis
msItem.incipit: Teneamus igitur firmissime patrem et filium
msItem.rubric: Quod deus ubique totus sit potestate naturali
Quare dicatur deus in celo magis habitare quam in terra
Quomodo dicatur filius in euangelio nescire diem iudicii
msItem.ab: Extracts from Geronimus p. 3, Julianus Toletanus p. 4 etc. Ioh. Chrysostom p. 8, Aug. p. 9, etc.
msItem.rubric: Quod finito iudicio incipiet esse celum novum et terra noua
msItem.incipit: Ut ait beatus Augustinus peracto finitoque iudicio
msItem.rubric: Explicit de futuro seculo
Hec damaso papae scribit aurelius ipse
msItem.incipit: Beatissimo pape damaso aurelius Carthaginensis episcopus
msItem.rubric: Rescriptum damasi pape ad ipsum
msItem.ab: Extracts from Canons of Councils and from Fathers (Aug., Jeron., Greg., Isidore, etc.: the latest are Bede and Rabanus Maurus quoted on pp. 53, 74 and 134). They begin with a paragraph
msItem.incipit: Canones generalium conciliorum a temporibus constantini ceperunt
msItem.rubric: Que sint rata concilia
Ex concilio bonefacii pape qui iiiitus a beato Gregorio fuit
Ysodorus in sinonimis de voto
Ex canone apostolorum de ordinando episcopo
Item de sacrisicio (!) domini
Item de fideiussioribus (!) clericorum
Ex concilio Cartaginensi habita ab episcopis xcvi kal. Sept.
Innocentius in epistola ad Decentium
Idem ad Ruffum et Eusebium episcopos, etc.
msItem.ab: On p. 25 begins a series of quotations from the False Decretals
msItem.rubric: Incipit decreta Clementis pape
msItem.incipit: Si qui ex fratribus negotia habent inter se
msItem.ab: The subjects of the extracts are not marked off by rubrics. The last appear to deal with the treatment of errors in doctrine: after two from Popes Zosimus and Caelestinus follows
msItem.rubric: Ieronimus de membris domini nostri
msItem.incipit: Omnipotens deus pater et filius et spiritus sanctus unus est atque trinus unus uidelicet in natura trinus in personis
msItem.explicit: sine sono uocis uel quolibet strepitu. occulte in mentibus sanctorum uoluntatem suam atque rectum inspirare siue futura
msItem.ab: Opera ed. Martianay V 120, P. L. XLII 1199

recordHist.p: remarks: question about replacing roman numerals with words (iiiitus = quartus), etc.
